body: Thanks @tacigar !
Thanks!

verified

```bash
$ docker ps
CONTAINER ID        IMAGE                            COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS                    PORTS                                          NAMES
a1183bf8dd51        grafana/grafana                  "/run.sh"                11 seconds ago      Up 10 seconds             0.0.0.0:3000->3000/tcp                         grafana
9a8aac993ff4        prom/prometheus                  "/bin/prometheus --c…"   12 seconds ago      Up 11 seconds             0.0.0.0:9090->9090/tcp                         prometheus
8d2c458100f6        openzipkin/zipkin-dependencies   "crond -f"               12 seconds ago      Up 11 seconds                                                            dependencies
a15e3d9d07f5        openzipkin/zipkin:test           "/bin/sh -c /zipkin/…"   12 seconds ago      Up 11 seconds (healthy)   9410/tcp, 0.0.0.0:9411->9411/tcp               zipkin
fd6755ad0c8b        openzipkin/zipkin-kafka:test     "/bin/sh -c /kafka/b…"   12 seconds ago      Up 11 seconds (healthy)   2181/tcp, 9092/tcp, 0.0.0.0:19092->19092/tcp   kafka-zookeeper
de98851f6db1        openzipkin/zipkin-mysql          "/bin/sh -c /mysql/r…"   12 seconds ago      Up 11 seconds             3306/tcp                                       mysql
```

Thank you @mrajah-twttr !!

`isLeftText` means....

* `isLeftText === false`: the span's name and duration texts will be placed on the right side of the bar.
    * ![スクリーンショット 2020-08-05 18 13 04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19551419/89394714-5fe95b00-d747-11ea-8a89-6afebc72e058.png)
* `isLeftText === true`: the span's name and duration text will be places on the left side of the bar.
    * ![スクリーンショット 2020-08-05 18 13 16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19551419/89394958-ab036e00-d747-11ea-8db7-697f52c92e25.png)

Now, when `isLeftText === true`, spanId is shown in here...

![スクリーンショット 2020-08-05 18 20 13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19551419/89395503-61ffe980-d748-11ea-9373-b2d5ebf359a4.png)

> if you search by service name and then you try to edit the box and remove all the content (quick way to clear the service name you entered) the "servicename" option is not present any more in suggested options (i see spanName and other options which are assuming service name is present)? does it make sense to keep search criteria and search text in separate text boxes instead of a single text box with servicename=? i think this is the same issue jorgheymans noted

I see! I understand!

> does it make sense to not have the user click on the + on load and open up with the the first search box ready to be filled.
i believe this is an issue even in existing UI but when you start typing the service name the characters dont show up right away until the lookahead is returned making it feel like a hang at times. since we are in the same code base would be great if we can fix it?

I see...
You mean the searchbar does not have to be shown until serviceNames has been loaded, right?
It's OK to me.
But the same problem occurs with `spanNames` and `remoteServiceNames`.
The list of spanName and remoteServiceName candidates are loaded after the serviceName associated with them has been determined.
So there is always a waiting time for the list of spanName and remoteServiceName to load when we input criteria to searchbar.
So for now, I'm not going to handle that issue in this PR.
We can change it later.

> seems the last set dropdown is auto expanded when pressing back from the trace detail view:

Yeah...I removed this feature.
I thought it wasn't necessary :)

> clicking on the unit in the duration makes the field disappear, could not reproduce consistently but happened often:

Ah, I see...
I removed the unit's dropdown feature because keyboard is faster and easier than dropdown 😢

thanks. any suggestion on how i can show the spanId for isLeftText == true or idea on how to fix the css to make it align correctly at start of box.. 

any other suggestions on the code itself?

I think adding the span ID to trace bar is cluttered. why would you add it to the bar? Are you trying to search for a span ID? Maybe a search would be better? If we know more maybe there's a cleaner way.
here's some background reading https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/2921
in general when adding features added a few times one trick is to cc people who worked on them last time. It will get feedback, or has a chance to.
any other feedback welcome post merge also! thanks @anuraaga

@anuraaga so to clarify as I think I know the answer. When webhook failed or the build failed for reasons like maven sync timeout.. we push docker-N.N.N from anywhere on master, correct? It doesn't have to be the same as the tag N.N.N

hi. how are you using this? what you are mentioning is a test image. what is your tracing setup use as it is odd to try multiple storage as typically end users only use one.

regardless does the main Cassandra docker image work on arm64? if not then probably try that first or reference back here how it is working upstream as this is only a dev copy.
PTAL 🙇

Thanks @tacigar ! Some more comments

- when doing browser-back button from the trace detail screen, an empty search criteria box always appears. 
![Peek 2020-08-06 15-25](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/89537434-a39c9d00-d7f9-11ea-9749-ae0076061fae.gif) 
- When editing for example the span name, should we not again display the full list straight away instead of letting users do backspace to erase and then start matching against the list entries ? Just a thought, hard to explain let me know if it does not make sense.
![Peek 2020-08-06 15-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/89540361-35f27000-d7fd-11ea-8dd1-31ada2143cc8.gif)

> when doing browser-back button from the trace detail screen, an empty search criteria box always appears.

Curious... 🤔 
I could not reproduce that behavior.
Could you tell me the URL when the empty criteria are displayed?

> When editing for example the span name, should we not again display the full list straight away instead of letting users do backspace to erase and then start matching against the list entries ? Just a thought, hard to explain let me know if it does not make sense.

I understand what you mean and I agree with you!
But implementation is going to be more complicated than it looks... 😢 
Is it possible to make it future work?

yes, its to allow ctrl-f search similar to how we search even service name currently. a search bar might be more powerful (search for anno or anything else in any span) but might be a much bigger change with complexity.. A small font spanId at end  seemed like a natural fit.

Given its a dev tool i felt its more valuable  to be functional than aesthetic but i understand if you feel its making it too cluttered.

> > when doing browser-back button from the trace detail screen, an empty search criteria box always appears.
> 
> Curious... thinking
> I could not reproduce that behavior.
> Could you tell me the URL when the empty criteria are displayed?
Here is how to reproduce
* start off at http://localhost:9411/zipkin/
* add servicename, then span name, then press enter at this moment:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/89577949-b763f580-d831-11ea-968c-76bd15a955ee.png)
* then click on one of the traces
* then browser-back
* the URL is now http://localhost:9411/zipkin/?serviceName=zipkin-server&spanName=get+%2Fzipkin%2Fapi%2Fv2%2Fremoteservices&=&lookback=15m&endTs=1596744750320&limit=10 
 
> I understand what you mean and I agree with you!
> But implementation is going to be more complicated than it looks... cry
> Is it possible to make it future work?
:+1:

Are you typically searching around for multiple span IDs in one trace or just one? this will steer things

Ex assuming one..

I think in dep graph we have a search by service name which is one option and far less cluttered than putting N possibly NNNN span IDs on the screen.

Another option is to allow pasting the span ID into the window which would scroll to it directly. ex trace/trace_id-span_id similarly support dash encoding to jump to span ID in the go to trace thing.

@drolando @jorgheymans @llinder @narayaruna thoughts on hopping to one span?
@bulicekj lazy github search.. does haystack-ui have a jump to span ID thing of any kind in trace view, or another way to get to a specific span?

ok I may not fully understand but it seems at least dirty stats could be at
play here. that and possibly a controller we have should be marked opt out
of metrics or both..

there's an expensive annotation for spring boot tests called
DirtiesApplicationContext or something for the former..

On Fri, Aug 7, 2020, 9:41 AM minux <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@minwoox* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In
> zipkin-server/src/test/java/zipkin2/server/internal/prometheus/ITZipkinMetrics.java
> <https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/3167#discussion_r466774350>:
>
> > @@ -77,7 +77,7 @@
>
>
>
>      // ensure we don't track prometheus, UI requests in prometheus
>
>      assertThat(scrape())
>
> -      .doesNotContain("prometheus")
>
> +      .doesNotContain("prometheus_notifications")
>
>
> The metric contains
> service="zipkin2.server.internal.prometheus.ZipkinMetricsController" so
> it's the problem. 😄
>
> Here's the story.
> We fixed to add FQCN of the service name for HTTP services as a metric tag
> in 0.99.7. line/armeria#2780 <https://github.com/line/armeria/pull/2780>
> So if the call is made to
> ZipkinMetricsController.fetchMetricsFromMicrometer(),
> one of the metric recorded is
> ...method="fetchMetricsFromMicrometer",service="zipkin2.server.internal.prometheus.ZipkinMetricsController",quantile="0.0"...
>
> But we had a bug in 0.99.8 that the MetricCollectingService is not
> automatically added.
> If Armeria server is created using spring boot integration and
> ArmeriaSettings.isEnableMetric() returns true, MetricCollectingService is
> added by default.
>
> https://github.com/line/armeria/pull/2898/files#diff-58a90bb70d1f88b9c2f45ee9bddd4468R126
>
> https://github.com/line/armeria/pull/2898/files#diff-58a90bb70d1f88b9c2f45ee9bddd4468R148
>
> So from 0.99.9 we add MetricCollectingService the Server so all the
> requests and responses are recorded by default.
>
> Now, metricsIsOK() is executed before prometheusIsOK() is executed during
> the test which records the metric about
> service="zipkin2.server.internal.prometheus.ZipkinMetricsController"
> which contains prometheus that make the test fails.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/3167#discussion_r466774350>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAAPVV4EYH5C5ARLWO76IODR7NLWHANCNFSM4PWLJZZQ>
> .
>
@jorgheymans fixed 🙇

> that and possibly a controller we have should be marked opt out
of metrics or both..

Or we could just remove the `MetricCollectingService` that is added by Armeria spring boot autoconfiguration. It seems like Zipkin is collecting metrics of the requests under `/zipkin/api` and `/api`, we might not need the default `MetricCollectingService`. 😆 
https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/zipkin-server/src/main/java/zipkin2/server/internal/prometheus/ZipkinPrometheusMetricsConfiguration.java#L91-L96

Let me just disable the `ArmeriaSettings.enableMetrics`.

Thanks @minwoox! I think maybe only main metrics we need to make sure work are the elasticsearch client ones particularly as we are using client-side loadbalancing. I'm not sure we don't already have IT for that.

as armeria also implies a dependency on netty it might conflict things worse than junit does for those using this package. Maybe do a quick github search? I think vert.x uses it at least.

There's also https://github.com/square/okhttp/pull/6192 trying to address the problem from 16 days ago.. Is it possible we can keep this okhttp in other words, so I think while I understand the affection for armeria we should be fair about the problem also maybe?

specifically unless you are already using armeria would this change given that okhttp will split the classes up, be a better way out? Do we think the netty dep of armeria will be ok generally?

one thing I believe is prove or disprovable is where this lib is used.. if something else that uses netty like google's grpc is in place, knowing people tend to pin specific versions of netty, we'd have a problem that wasn't there before.

OTOH if no one is using it in such a scenario, we can rightly dismiss it. Even if there is, we can get an ack from folks about what impact they'd have on it, possibly even kicking this project to a contrib repo.

Before brave-tests we needed this a lot more than we need it nowadays, though it is true that projects who initialize statically need it. Ex I think Skywalking just recently started using this. Haven't looked if they use netty or not or are pinned to a version that armeria isn't compatible with.

> I think maybe only main metrics we need to make sure work are the elasticsearch client ones particularly as we are using client-side loadbalancing. I'm not sure we don't already have IT for that.

I counddn't find the IT for that. But `ArmeriaSettings.enableMetrics` is just about server-side, so no effect for the clients. 😉 

And the test failure seems flaky, do you have a chance to re-run it, please?
Yeah I only glanced at https://github.com/square/okhttp/pull/6192 - it seemed to not be moving but am ok with waiting for it. Good point about the potential for netty dependency hell.
Excellent. Thanks for the help and followup @minwoox Thanks for the review feedback @anuraaga !
Thanks for reviewing! I hope I can have more chances to do more work on Zipkin. 😄
Oops! test failed

ps if we go the current approach, assuming this is only for ctrl-f.. I would make the font almost transparent. It will work in find and not clutter as barely visible. I still think it will distract so prefer a different way, but this is less distracting.
@jorgheymans merge if you think this addresses your comments, ya?

Sorry, please wait for merge.
I'll update unit tests which are failing soon.
updated 🙇

Lens' unit tests succeeded.
![スクリーンショット 2020-08-07 21 08 02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19551419/89644136-41739300-d8f2-11ea-9088-d3d574587bc0.png)

i prefer keeping the spanId small instead of transparent so there is no confusion on where the cursor landed.. Typically just 1 span (given spanId are unique should have only one match)

FWIW i would love to have a search box but this is one of the most common features requested and would like a short term solution

I don't think search box, if that's the solution, is a long term change. I highlight this as there is existing code to search within a page (dependencies screen iirc). Maybe you can take a look at that?

Also we have to be aware of tech debt and not add things just to save some days of discussion which should be had.

Even doing this change at all before 3 different sites would use it is a stretch, asking to merge tech debt before even getting a response from other sites is premature.

We spent a lot of time to declutter the UI, lots of time in decisions last couple years. not only is embedding span IDs into bars clutter, but it is also uncommon in any UI. I don't think this is a good decision to do this especially if the main goal is to avoid a more complete feature. Users do not primarily think about the span IDs and detail is where they can be found when needed. anchors etc can also reveal (ex window can show a span searched for for bookmark purposes)
very cool. we will make the next release a minor so we can announce the smoother stuff
These were all fixed in https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/3076

I can see the need for an easy way to jump to a span if the trace is very large or contains many similar looking spans (e.g. batch process messaging), but adding them visually into the UI is just not nice aesthetically. 

There might be a path towards this though. If we consider span being a 'subresource' of a trace, then URL wise it would need to show up as an [URI fragment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URI_fragment). If Lens were to support such fragments e.g. `http://localhost:9411/zipkin/traces/f2882c7bde1c028e#92168a494b0c68318`, we could load the trace detail screen with a specific span highlighted. UI wise, people could then just develop a bookmarklet that prompts for the span id and adds it to the URI. This would be beneficial for Lens in general (ability to 'deep link' into a span), and you could piggy back it for your search needs. WDOT ?

Thanks @tacigar, if it's not too much effort could you provide before/after (side-by-side whatever) screenshots perhaps ? Would make it easier for us (well at least for me) to follow and comment on the the design update.

Closing this what seems to be a food-for-thought issue. AFAICT `parentSpanId` is always propagated unless root-span. See https://github.com/openzipkin/b3-propagation#parentspanid. Feel free to correct me if i'm out in the wrong here or if it's more nuanced.

note i was unable to run the IT locally due to docker woes ...

@adriancole given that you logged https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/2220 , do you remember which deprecated feature triggered you to create the issue ? Is there a scenario we could easily test this against ? Or a simple unit test outside of ES just for the decorator would suffice ?
@jeqo are you comfortable with `OFF` as default kafka logging level ? I hesitated to put `WARN` but most sites don't detect kafka issues in their logs anyway I figured ... WDYT ?

before / after screenshot possibly annotating by drawing on after screen
shot to say what's important will be helpful to folks less familiar with
nuance to know the specific changes

the primary usecase is when traces are discovered outside zipkin, we have a couple of such usecases
1. Our logs contain traceId and spanId
2. offline storage with larger retention where we perform more complex data mining and find some exmplar traces.

thanks for picking this up @jorgheymans !

I think you'll need two things:

1. Check for "cluster, node, and index level settings that use deprecated features that will be removed or changed in the next major version" with the `GET _migration/deprecations` API: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/migration-api-deprecation.html
  That's for any "static" settings and should require the free Basic license. IMO you could just run through your integration tests and check if the response of that API is empty.
2. For query deprecations there should be a custom header in the response. Example:

```sh
≻ curl -v -X GET "http://localhost:9200/users/_search" -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d'{ "query": { "match": { "name": { "query": "philipp", "cutoff_frequency": 0.1 } } } }'
*   Trying ::1:9200...
* Connected to localhost (::1) port 9200 (#0)
> GET /users/_search HTTP/1.1
> Host: localhost:9200
> User-Agent: curl/7.71.1
> Accept: */*
> Content-Type: application/json
> Content-Length: 116
> 
* upload completely sent off: 116 out of 116 bytes
* Mark bundle as not supporting multiuse
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Warning: 299 Elasticsearch-7.8.1-b5ca9c58fb664ca8bf9e4057fc229b3396bf3a89 "Deprecated field [cutoff_frequency] used, replaced by [you can omit this option, the [match] query can skip block of documents efficiently if the total number of hits is not tracked]"
< content-type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
< content-length: 262
< 
{"took":2,"timed_out":false,"_shards":{"total":1,"successful":1,"skipped":0,"failed":0},"hits":{"total":{"value":1,"relation":"eq"},"max_score":0.2876821,"hits":[{"_index":"users","_type":"_doc","_id":"1","_score":0.2876821,"_source":{
  "name": "Philipp"
}
* Connection #0 to host localhost left intact
}]}}
```

PS: Colon in the index name was already removed in 7.0, so you'd need to test that one against 6.x

```sh
curl -v -X PUT "http://localhost:9200/user:name"
*   Trying ::1:9200...
* Connected to localhost (::1) port 9200 (#0)
> PUT /user:name HTTP/1.1
> Host: localhost:9200
> User-Agent: curl/7.71.1
> Accept: */*
> 
* Mark bundle as not supporting multiuse
< HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
< content-type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
< content-length: 325
< 
* Connection #0 to host localhost left intact
{"error":{"root_cause":[{"type":"invalid_index_name_exception","reason":"Invalid index name [user:name], must not contain ':'","index_uuid":"_na_","index":"user:name"}],"type":"invalid_index_name_exception","reason":"Invalid index name [user:name], must not contain ':'","index_uuid":"_na_","index":"user:name"},"status":400}
```
awesome feedback folks!

> @bulicekj lazy github search.. does haystack-ui have a jump to span ID thing of any kind in trace view, or another way to get to a specific span?

We do not. We've got this in our backlog as a feature request but I have found just using the browser find on the raw trace is good enough for most situations. However as mentioned above the more spans that have similar service/operation names the worse that experience becomes. 

My opinion is the transparent text is an OK temporary solution but few people would think to search for invisible text. It would be much better to have a small searchbar that highlighted the matching span(s)

+1 on the jorgheymans suggestion. While I think it will be a half feature
ak think it is better than adding the span ID for EVERY span in the trace.
I am also concerned about edge cases, for example what happens if you
changed the local root and the span is not anymore in the screen? In that
sense I think the anchor approach is still good as it can point you
directly to that span by changing the local root.

I've heard the word resilience4j lately - never used it but just a reference

something possibly in the latest micrometer or spring boot update has the prometheus registry not clearing when DirtiesContext (ex POST count is 7 not 1). I'll revert that part as it was unrelated anyway

Reslience4j and Failsafe are interesting options but, when evaluating them, make sure they solve the problem this is looking to address.

Namely, storage gets backed up so we need to slow down how much we're writing to it but do so in a way that doesn't cause the server to exhaust memory.  In this particular case, a limited-size queue is used to buffer some data while we have a small bottleneck we're working with.  Some simple retries with an appropriate backoff policy could address the same basic problem of slow storage but may be harder to tame with respect to pending actions.  Meaning, I can't say how hard it is to prevent an "infinite queue" with the retry handlers.

FWIW, the ExecutorService that backs this implementation is pretty universal and supported by Java.  The only part that is not is the one that adjusts how many threads are allowed to be active in it.  To a certain extent, that logic could be directly incorporated into Zipkin instead of pulled in via Netflix.

PS we don't always cut release notes until a later patch. ex 2.19.2 as it is important that the inner circle verifies before we notify people with a release. it is intentional. We only do release notes for minors unless there's a good reason not to, and also this is to do with effort levels as this is a completely volunteer project.

> The current result table has _filtering feature_.
> Is this necessary?

Does this only allow filtering by service name? Is there a way to search for traces containing two or more different services? Maybe it is used for that, but if the search can do that maybe it isn't needed.

Unrelated and not critical to address in this pull request as I assume it is existing behavior, but what is the sorting of the service names? It made me wonder if it isn't more helpful to sort them by the highest number of spans if there isn't other meaning to the current order.

Someone who uses Zipkin on a regular basis should probably chime in on whether the service names being visible or not (without mousing over) affects their usual workflow (e.g. ctrl+F search in page for service... though I guess this is what the filter mentioned above is for).
